meta_description: The History of Diving Museum is an independent, not-for-profit. The Museum is dedicated to the preservation, education and exhibition of the History of Diving.
hours_text:
**History of Diving Museum**  
82990 Overseas Hwy (MM83)  
Islamorada, FL 33036  
305-664-9737

Open 10-5 Daily

## 

## Admission Price

Adults: $15  
Seniors (62+): $13  
Children 6-11: $7  
Children 5 and Under: FREE

[](https://divingmuseum.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/All-Minors-with-adults-smweb.png)

US Veterans: $12  
**US Active Military: FREE**  
College Students w/ ID: $11  
NARM Members: FREE  
SNAP recipients: FREE

**Blue Star Museum:** US Active Military and up to Five Family Members: FREE  
Armed Forces Day: 5/17/25- Labor Day: 9/1/25

**Youth/Student Group Rates  
**Ages 6-11 (Elementary and middle school age groups) - $6.00 per person, with a minimum of 12 paid​  
Ages 12-21 (High school and post-secondary age groups) - $11.00 per person, with a minimum of 12 paid​  
Accompanying teachers, troop leaders, and/or chaperones - one free adult per six paying students, additional adults are $11.00 per person  
Groups with youth under 14 years of age require a minimum of one chaperone per 6 children.

**Tours should be scheduled at least two weeks in advance.** For private groups of more than 15 desiring a presentation or guided tour, please call 305-664-9737 for reservations or email [programs@divingmuseum.org](mailto:programs@divingmuseum.org) and our staff will be happy to assist you.

**​Museum Store**  
Visit our Museum Store for unique gifts.  
Open 10am - 5pm Daily

[Shop online 24 hours a day](https://shop-diving-museum.company.site/)

accessibility_text:
**Quick Links:**

##  Accessibility Statement for HDM

**Accessibility Statement for History of Diving Museum**

History of Diving Museum is committed to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities. We are continually improving the user experience for everyone, and applying the relevant accessibility standards.

**Conformance status**

The [Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG)(opens in a new tab),](https://www.w3.org/WAI/standards-guidelines/wcag/) defines requirements for designers and developers to improve accessibility for people with disabilities. It defines three levels of conformance: Level A, Level AA, and Level AAA. History of Diving Museum is partially conformant with WCAG 2.1 level AA. Partially conformant means that some parts of the content do not fully conform to the accessibility standard.

**Feedback**

We welcome your feedback on the accessibility of History of Diving Museum. Please let us know if you encounter accessibility barriers on History of Diving Museum’s website:

  * Phone: +01 305 664 9737
  * E-mail: [director@divingmuseum.org](mailto:director@divingmuseum.org)
  * Postal address: 82990 Overseas Highway, Islamorada, FL 33036

We try to respond to feedback within 5 business days.

**Quick Links:**

# January Immerse Yourself & the Grand Opening of Dive Into Art: Stories from the Sea!

# [Click Here for a Full Schedule of Museum Events](https://divingmuseum.org/events-calendar/)

[ ](https://shop-diving-museum.company.site/products/Dive-Into-Art-Stories-from-the-Sea-c191326003)

[ ](https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/XH7I9IQLQHWZN_FDvsnwWA)

###  Immerse Yourself!

#  Join us online or in-person!

# Creating "Dive Into Art: Stories from the Sea"

with Adrienne Z and Diane Smith, Art Guild of the Purple Isles

Be sure to come early for the grand opening of Dive Into Art: Stories from the Sea!

Join artists Adrienne Z and Diane Smith of the Art Guild of the Purple Isles as they take us through the creation of the History of Diving Museum's newest featured exhibit Dive Into Art: Stories from the Sea. Learn about outreach programs to local schools, how the artwork and performances were created, and what lies in store for the Art Guild's future projects.

Immerse Yourself presentations are held on the third Wednesday of the month and are offered free of charge. The History of Diving Museum offers extended hours on Immerse Yourself nights, with the last admission ticket into the exhibits available at 6:45 PM.

Thank you to this month’s sponsors: the Monroe County Tourist Development Council, Culture Builds Florida, and the Newton Family.

Questions or concerns? E-mail programs@divingmuseum.org!

**Wed | January 21st | 7 pm**
